result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance A Keota was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Present Sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with the co-actor or with any Associated Bank. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Mainatin employment and/or school combination. 
  Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha. 
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance A Keota in court, in custody, with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing rcommendation.  Attorney Bihler makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

18 YEARS IMPRISONMENT       **Consecutive to present sentence** 
  -    8 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  10 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  Co-actor or with any Associated Bank
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
  

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
Character letter dated 08/29/16, filed by Atty Bihler.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Stanley Correctional Institution.
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits #1-23, 24-26, 27, 29, 30, 31, 49-55, , 57-62, 65 & 66.  
Exhibit #28 & 34  - Withdrawn.
Exhibits # 32, 33, 43 & 56 Never offered or received.
Exhibits #35 & 36 are non-scannable (DVD's)
Exhibits #37-42 and 44-48 stored in exhibit room
verdict forms submitted by the jury
alternate juror selection

Defendant Lance A Keota in court, in custody, with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Day 3 of jury trial.  Case called at 8:40 a.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 8:41 a.m.  Detective David Van Ells is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #58, 59, 60, 62 and 66 shown to witness and the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Detective Timothy Probst is sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibits #61, 29 and 30 are shown to witness and the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Detective Steven Guth is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Court takes short break at 9:50 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:02 a.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 10:03 a.m.  Specialist Nichelle Nelson is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibit #52, 40, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 46, 51, 53, 63, 64, 50, 47 and 48 are shown to the witness and jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Brittany P. is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #55, 47, 48, 57 and 64 are shown to the witness and jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.   Re-direct by the state.  Tennita F. is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #59, 65 and 66 are shown to the witness and jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Court excuses jurors for a break at 11:30 a.m.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #1-27, 29-31, 35-42, 44-55 and 57-66.  Court receives those exhibits.  Exhibits #28 and 34 are withdrawn by the state.  Attorney Bihler states he has no witnesses and that Defendant will not be testifying.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant states he does NOT wish to testify.  Jurors enter courtroom at 11:44 a.m.   Court advises jurors of admitted exhibits.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Court excuses jurors for lunch at 11:50 a.m. and orders them to return for jury instructions and closing arguments at 1:20 p.m.  Counsel to return at 1:00 p.m. to go through jury instructions.  Court reconvenes at 1:14 p.m. and goes through jury instructions with both counsel.  Jurors enter courtroom at 1:52 p.m.  Court reads jury instructions to jurors.  Closing statements given by the state.  Closing statements given by Attorney Bihler.  Rebuttal statements/arguments by the state.  Judge gives final jury instructions to jurors.  Alternate juror,which was randomly selected by computer, is announced by clerk.  Paul H. (alternate juror selected) is released/dismissed at 2:45 p.m.  Jurors begin deliberations at 2:47 p.m.  Jurors reach a verdict at 4:50 p.m. Court reconvenes at 5:25 p.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 5:25 p.m.  Court announces verdict.  Jurors find the Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Court polls the jury.  State moves for court to accept jury's verdict.  Attorney Bihler moves for acquittal.  Court enters judgment based on jury's finding of guilty.  Bail is revoked. Neither party requests presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.

AFTERNOON (DAY 2) a new court reporter is sitting in for this session of trial:  Defendant Lance A Keota in court, in custody, with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 1:21 p.m. for continued jury trial.  State's witness, Jason B., returns to the witness stand and the court reminds the witness that he is still under oath.  Attorney Galaviz continues with direct examination.  State plays video of exhibit 36.  Exhibit 65 and 66 are testified to.  Exhibit 35 is played for the witness. Attorney Bihler requests sidebar.  Court holds sidebar.  Direct examination continues.  Exhibits 37, 38, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44, 45 and 46 are opened and shown to witness and testified to.   Side bar held.  Attorney Bihler questions witness on cross-examination.  Side bar held.  Attorney Galaviz questions witness on re-direct.  No further questions by either party.  Court is in recess at 3:00 pm to reconvene at 3:10.  Court reconvenes at 3:17 pm. 
Madison P. is sworn-in and testifies. Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Court adjourns at 4:00 p.m. and orders jurors to return tomorrow, July 14, 2016 at 8:20 a.m. for continuation of jury trial.  Court order for Attorney Bihler to see Defendant in the jail during non-visitation hours provided to Attorney Bihler.
(Orig.) ... and certificate of appearance. For Logan A Dargatz. Filed by the State.
(Orig.) ... and certificate of appearance. For Hannah Jean Cantrell. Filed by the State.
(Orig.) ... and certificate of appearance. For Daniel Streicher. Filed by the State.
signed by Judge Lloyd Carter allowing Attorney Bihler to meet with Defendant during non-visitation hours to continue preparations for trial.

MORNING (DAY 2):  Defendant Lance A Keota in court, in custody, with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Day 2 of jury trial at 8:40 a.m.  Court goes through some witness issues with parties. Jurors enter courtroom at 8:48 a.m.  Case proceeds to testimony.  States Exhibits #65 & 66 marked.  Nicole O. is sworn-in and testifies.   Sidebar.  State continues with direct examination of witness.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Leticia O. is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Court takes short recess at 10:03 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:24 a.m.  Witness Jason B. , in custody is on witness stand.  Witness' attorney, Jorge Fragoso is present and briefly spoke with witness prior to case being called.  Court performs colloquy with witness regarding his fifth amendement rights and his right to testify/not testify as well as his constitutional rights.  Attorney Bihler requests the court to inquire as to if witness has filed an appeal on his case.  Defendant states he has filed an appeal and Attorney Fragoso informs the court that he has gone over that issue with the witness as far as any implications and states he does object to issue of filing an appeal being brought up on direct or cross-examination of witness.  Sidebar.  Jurors enter courtroom at 10:40 a.m.  Jason B., in custody, is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #31, 40, 27 shown to witness and jury. Sidebar.  Court adjourns for lunch at 11:45 a.m. and orders jurors to return by 1:15 p.m..  This ends the morning session of day 2 of Jury Trial.
submitted by defense
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire
Voir Dire List

Defendant Lance A Keota in court, in custody, with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's exhibits marked.  Case called at 8:40 a.m. for 12 person jury trial.  Court goes through some preliminary issues for the trial. Court will sequester witnesses and parties agree.  Court takes issue of state's witnesses raised by Attorney Bihler under advisement.  Court will be utilizing an alternate juror due to potential length of this trial.  Jurors called for at 9:00 a.m.  Jurors arrive at 9:40 a.m.   Clerk swears in all potential jurors for voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire.   Attorney Bihler conducts voir dire.  Sidebar.  Gina S. and Shyla B. are both struck for cause.  Clerk announces next 2 potential jurors.  All parties conduct voir dire on those 2 potential jurors.  Parties practice peremptory strikes (5 each).  Clerk announces 13 selected jurors (includes 1 alternate juror).  Remaining jurors are released at 11:23 a.m.  Clerk swears in selected jurors who will try the issues.  Court takes short break. Court reconvenes at 11:40 a.m.  Court gives some jury instructions to jurors.  State gives opening statements.  Attorney Bihler gives opening statements.  Court adjourns for lunch at 12:10 p.m. and tells jurors to return at 1:20 p.m. to commence with trial.  Court reconvenes at 1:38 p.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 1:40 p.m.   Alyiah H. is sworn-in and testifies.   State's Exhibits #1 - 13 are shown to Defendant and the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler. Re-direct by the state.  Renata S. is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Court takes short recess at 3:10 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 3:25 p.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 3:26 p.m.  Logan D. is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #24 - 26 shown to witness and jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Hannah C. is sworn-in and testifies.  Sidebar.  Court excuses jurors for short break at 3:55 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 4:00 p.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 4:00 p.m.  State continues direct examination of witness.  State's Exhibits #14-16 shown to witness and jury.  Sidebar.  State continues direct examination of witness.  No cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Daniel S. is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibit #27 shown to witness and jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  Re-direct by the state.  Court adjourns to tomorrow, July 13, 2016 and orders jurors to report back at 8:20 a.m. on Wednesday, July 13, 2016.
